references.reason: This paper introduces the core concept of performative power, which is the central theoretical framework of the current study.
This paper lays the groundwork for understanding performative power by exploring performative prediction, a related concept that helps in quantifying the causal effects of algorithmic updates.
This foundational work in experimental design provides the theoretical justification for the randomized controlled trial (RCT) methodology employed in the study.

references.paper_title: Controlled experiments on the web: survey and practical guide
references.reason: This paper offers practical guidance on conducting online experiments, crucial for designing and executing the RCT in the study.

references.paper_title: Competition Policy for the digital era: Final report
references.reason: This report provides important context by discussing the challenges of applying traditional antitrust tools to digital markets, making the case for alternative approaches such as performative power.
